Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, good AC, nice front desk, great value”
Reviews.Author: Marleytawn
Reviews.Content: for a hotel that's in the middle of the city with this price, i thought the value was very good. that being said, it's very difficult to get in and out of hotel w a car. there is no place to pull up front, no porters, no parking. there are several stairs down to get to front desk and we had 3 heavy bags. the rooms and hotel were OK. the carpet was disgusting but the beds and sheets were clean, room was clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. the room had great AC, the hotel was located in a great area. walkable to all of madrid's highlights. the breakfast wasn't bad. for this price, we were totally fine w our stay. they are renovating so the hotel is surrounded by scaffolding and that is covered w plastic. but the windows still open which is nice. i'd recommend this hotel for sure if your watching your budget. if money isn't an issue, there are tons of great hotels around this area.

Reviews.Title: “Very very well located”
Reviews.Author: Tridevsadh
Reviews.Content: Iv Been to this hotel twice...I really liked the location as its very close to Madrid cities heart SOL...SOL is the main shopping and tourist spot in Madrid....ul find all major Spanish and other international clothing lines....so it's perfect for ppl who wana shop.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TDR87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for business, but it wasn't a very good stay. The staff wasn't friendly, They speak very bad English, and that was a bit of a problem when checking in and out. The breakfast wasn't tasty. It's very close to everything you need in Madrid, close to Metro and bus and there is a lot to see within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: alessia_boissieu
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is very good with many options. The location is excellent in the middle of Gran Via. Car park far away.

Reviews.Title: “want to share”
Reviews.Author: lex O
Reviews.Content: I'm go to traval alone i like this hotel cuase not expensive and clean if i go to madird again i'll back it.

Reviews.Title: “Building being renovated May 2012”
Reviews.Author: Hastingstraveler
Reviews.Content: Art Deco hotel but with very little of the original interior left. Excellent location for variety of metro stations and shopping. Good breakfasts. Single room small but with good bathrooms. Surprisingly quiet at night considering it is on one of Madrid's main thoroughfares. Extensive external renovation going on at the moment, building shrouded in plastic and scaffolding and therefore noisy during the day if you want a siesta. (Scaffolding right up to the window).

Reviews.Title: “xx”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location to visit the town like to be there. easy to find with metro from the airport xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Functional and in Heart of Madrid Action”
Reviews.Author: FairCityFrasie
Reviews.Content: Myself and a team of ageing footballers (12 of us in total) stayed here in four triple rooms for 4 nights between 27th and 1st May. The write-ups were not ideal and on arrival expectations remain low as you descend to the basement reception and lounge area....but from there on I only have praise for this hotel and I would definitely stay there again. The rooms (certainly the four that we had) were spacious, clean, well maintained and serviced promptly each morning. Breakfast, included in the price, was reasonably good (and predictable). I have only two downsides to report - (1) the huge numbers of guests who descended for breakfast each morning putting some degree of strain on the capacity and resources....but nevertheless the breakfast staff seemed to replenish stocks and turnaround tables very efficiently so that the experience was generally okay (I don't know if this is a regular thing or wether the hotel was operating at full capacity during our visit); and (2) there are only two very small elevators/lifts (one holds max 3 persons and the other holds max 4 persons) and like breakfast, these were sometimes incapable of handling demand....but a short wait or the star is were not a problem if you are able and have just a little patience. The reception staff too were efficient and courteous and handled any problems we had without fuss. We paid circa 1,500 Euros fro our 4 nights for 12 people, so I would say the Hotel Rex was very good value for money at under 30Euros per head per night. The location is brilliant for tourist city break only a few steps from the main shopping area, Puerta Del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real next to Corte Ingles and the Callao Metro. Masses of bars and restaurants everywhere around. Don't expect the Ritz or Hilton.....this is an inexpensive, traditional, Spanish style, 3 stars hotel in a great location in mid Gran - superb value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Titania2000
Reviews.Content: Easy walking to most of Madrid's attractions. The smallest lift I have ever seen in a hotel does not stop at street level. So suitcases have to be carted up and down stairs. Room was clean bed ok. Shower in bathtub. Staff friendly and helpful. Had some medicine that needed to be kept cool It was looked after by the staff as there was no fridge in the room.Toilet proved to be fragile and required a couple of service calls. Breakfast was very good with a lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best to lodge.”
Reviews.Author: Muguyaro
Reviews.Content: If you are a perfectionist, then it is not the best place to be. It is very good located on the main street so if you want real peace then choose another place to lodge. Breakfast was just not what I expected. Fruits from the tin can was not the best and the bread were too old and tables not cleaned etc. Furniture was old and the odour was also not the best in the hotel. The lift was too tight to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ROgalati
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is good. The rooms are clean, but the furniture a old. It is a basic hotel, the staff is kind an helpful, great location in Madrid. At the entrance of the hotel you have some stairs to go underground, where is the recetion. No elevator at the entrance to go underground for reception. If you have a big luggage this can be an inconvenience. From underground (reception) the hotel have elevator to go to your room. The elevator can be busy in time of breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY if you need a decent WiFi connection, otherwise rather good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabba8
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Clean hotel. Looks like well protected against fire. Excellent clean spacious room, good bedding, good fittings, safebox (1 EUR per usage), excellent sound-proof windows from street noise (very New York City). Good LCD TV except that the provided menu in the room doesn't correspond at all to the reality (less channels as advertised). Smoking room upon request. Excellent housekeeping and friendly staff Excellent breakfast (wide choice and quality products) and long hours (up to 11am), with great staff. Excellent location near 3 metro stations (the best way to move in Madrid beside walking) BAD: The poor quality of the WiFi connection, very low signal, most of the time none, and getting frequently disconnected. I found out the best place to catch a low signal: the bathroom sitting on the toilet... 2 connected PC's in the lobby are available free but I also experienced with them some glitches too. Bad front office staff. Never we felt we were welcomed. Not even a "thank you" at check-out. Addressed with the WiFi issue, the FO manager try to behave surprised by my claim, and some others at different shifts admitted they were aware but don't say anything if something was underway to solve that. It appeared to me that no one is handling the case.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: mtfenek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and clean but rooms need some reburshment. Bathroom door does not close. Bathroom tiles have black mould surrounding them. Carpets in the room are needed when the weather gets colder. Air-conditioning in our room was reported and it was not fixed by he time we left 2 days later. but above all it was clean and very very central. Breakfast was good too BUT staff should smile every now and then. All in all it was ok but a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Michal27
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend and our experience of the hotel was better than what the reviews said. There is'nt an elevator at the street level of the hotel so everytime you go in or out, you have to go up or down a flight of stairs to get to an elevator. For young people in shape this should not be a problem. For a 3 star hotel I was pleasantly surprised, the room was small but very clean and comfortable. The location is perfect- we didn't have to use the metro almost at all. Breakfast was good with a variety of foods. The receptionists were not so kind or helpful and most of them did not know english. WIFI is free at the hotel but not always worked. All in all, I would return to this hotel if i were to be in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: sbabe
Reviews.Content: The street level of the hotel doesnt have an elevator, you have to carry laugage by yourself all the way down to reception and then up when you leave. we arrived in the middle of the night with two babies - they refused to help!!! the elevatores in the other floors are tiny, most of the time we walked up and down the stairs, like most of the guests there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to explore Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Aspinfamily
Reviews.Content: this hotel does not deserve the bad reviews it has received! we have just returned from a city break in Madrid and stayed at this hotel. the location is excellent and a great base in which to explore the city and all major attractions. It is a 3 star and is exactly that. reception staff were helpful polite and friendly. Rooms were kept clean daily by the maids and were spacious. hotel overall very clean. free wi-fi Breakfast very good and great variety. restaurant staff also good. could not fault any aspect of this hotel and would recommend it as a base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhum999
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Rex in Madrid. It is what it says it is a 3 star. Clean hotel, maids did a good job every day, reception staff were friendly, I needed a sewing kit and they had one, which wasnt a problem to them. Breakfast was good, good variety. Excellent location for loads of attractions. We stayed in room 310 which had no view as it looked out onto the void space between our hotel and next door but we were only sleeping and showering there so we didnt mind, was actually nice to get some peace and quiet as the city is constantly buzzing. My only complaint was other guests being noisy froom 6.30am and throughout the night as the hotel is not soundproof. People like to bang doors!!! Very close to Sol and Plaza Mayor which are nice areas. We took the city tour bus which was good and then the next day we walked to many of the attractions. We ate at a New Orleans restaurant called Gumbo well worth a visit the staff were very helpful and excellent food. Alot of police about which was good to see but never felt threatened at any time. Will definately be returning to Madrid and would recommend this hotel to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great with a few adjustments”
Reviews.Author: JessandThomas
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good location to do some sightseeing in Madrid, this is a very good place to stay. The hotel is right on the Calle Gran Via (main road), close to a metro stop but also convenient when you want to walk to all the hotspots in town. We had a room in one of the upper floors on the street side. Although the room was in a corner, partially facing the main road, we never heard any noise wile we were sleeping. During the day time, you would here the traffic and buzz of people walking by, but not to loud that it would upset you. I have to say we never slept with the window open because the air-co worked perfectly. The room was very clean with comfortable beds, enough room in the bathroom and enough space in the closet for clothes of two girls :D Breakfast is really lovely. There is plenty to choose from. Enough variation between hot and cold food. If you're staying a couple of nights like we did, you won't get tired of the buffet because you can easily make something different every day. The downside of the hotel is the entrance ! The reception is one floor below entrance level of the hotel, with no lift to gown down. Not a problem when you're young and able to carry all your luggage but this can be difficult if you are elderly and have problems carrying heavy luggage. From the reception floor, you have two little lifts to get to the rooms. Just enough for two people. I stayed here with a good friend and we would recommend this hotel to others friends that want to do some sightseeing in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalNative7
Reviews.Content: Had my doubts about this place, given the reviews, but it worked out fine. The location is fantastic--right on the Gran Ville and an easy walk to many of Madrid's hot spots. The people at the desk were meh, neither warm nor rude. It was nice that the lobby had free internet. Our room was on the 5th floor, so we didn't experience any street noise. Also, we were far enough from the elevator that we didn't hear internal noise, either. But a note on the elevator: It is, indeed, tiiiiiiny. And as many others point out, you have to carry your luggage down/up from reception. Not a big deal for us, but could be an issue for others. The free breakfast was delicious! Huge selection of yogurt, cereal, breads, cheese, even scrumptious tortilla (that I believe was better than at any tapas restaurant). Really appreciated being able to fuel up before hitting the city. All in all, a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Not many complaints for a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: chas999Yorks
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Hotel Rex on two occasions. 8th and 9th june and 17th,18th and 19th June. I found the hotel clean, pleasant and with an excellent buffett breakfast. The only problem that i found , was that there was no plug for the sink in the bathroom. No problem, i am only here for two nights. I came back a week later and stopped in a different room on the second floor. Well blow me down there was no plug for the sink again! Irritated and curious i went to the reception and mentioned this problem, and i was informed THAT THERE WAS NO PLUGS IN THE ENTIRE HOTEL! i kid you not. From here, the male receptionist bent down and produced for me, a plug with a 12 inch chain on it and gave it to me. (I duly returned the plug when i paid my bill a few days later when i left the hotel). If i had not stopped in 2 seperate rooms at the hotel on 2 different occasions, the plug situation would not have come to light because i think everyone of us would have put up with the inconvenience for a few days as it is so trivial a complaint. Also one problem to be aware of is that the hotel reception is not at street level. The reception is down at basement level - with no lift and you therefore have to manhandle your bags down the stairs to the reception. Also on checking out of the hotel you then have the same problem. You then have to manhandle bags up to street level. i saw one or two elderly people struggle a little with their bags. Having said all of the above, i wouldn't hesitate to stay there again at the hotel. Although there was more noise on the second floor, this was mainly due to inconsiderate guests talking loudly and banging doors.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, adequate room and breakfast. Good value”
Reviews.Author: JuliaNorthampton_UK
Reviews.Content: If you want to be handy for the traditonal tourist attractions then this is ideally situated - on the Gran Via just below Callao and above Plaza de Espana. The room was perfectly adequate as was the breakfast and overal value for money was good.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: PMD_63
Reviews.Content: Great location on Gran Via. Close proximity to two metro's, shopping, restaurants and places of interest for site seeing. Royal Palace, museums within 5 minutes walking distance. Bus stops just opposite to the hotel to visit various places including the Real Madrid stadium. The Airport bus stops at Celebus which is just about a KM away. Excellent breakfast, clean decent size rooms. Wifi is free but slow. Room doors make sound. No refrigerator in the room. Overall great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meiki065
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was really really bad, overall is a regular hotel, acommodations, personel, etc etc etc, but my last night of stay, I went out to have dinner with my family, and when we come back someone had gotten into our room, and had stolen a brand new iPod wich I purchased that same day and a montblanc pen, when I realized this, I went to the lobby to notifiy what happened, and there were several other guests complaining about stolen goods like, computers, videocameras, etc etc. The hotel had a CCTV system but strangely they couldn't pick anything from the videotapes. None of the doors was broken or even scratched, the hotel used a keycard system for the opening of the doors, so the one that entered had to be someone that knew that and that could gain acces to more than 10 rooms with a simple keycard. Needless to say that the hotel never gave us any money as insurance policy and they refuse to disscount the price of the stolen goods from the price of the stay. It was a horrible horrible experience to feel so vulnerable, and also to feel that the people in your own hotel who should be the ones that have insurance and pay you for the stolen goods, may be the ones that entered to your room in the first place. I advice you to never never never stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: Mackerrall01
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group of 15 people, this was a trip arranged by college.We were only told alittle about where we were going and the hotel we were staying at. To find out more we researched some reviews which didnt sound very good, which worried us. On the arrival of our hotel, it only took two short bus journey to reach which was ideal as we were all tired from travelling since early hours of the morning. The hotel was great letting us check in early so we could shower and change. The hotel lifts were incredibly tiny, only two people could fit. It was a tight squeeze with our suitcases. When we got to the room the air conditioning didnt work so we opened the window but couldnt keep it open as it was to noisy. The area around the hotel is lovely, wouldnt fault that! Breakfast was simple but very nice. Supermarket next door was handy. Bathroom was very clean. All round good hotel, good location, food food but no luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Lugore
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic. Good relation quality/price. stayed on the 9th floor, good views. staff was very friendly. travelled with a baby, they have microwave which was very handy. location amazing! you have everything you need in front or next to the hotel. buffet breakfast was included in the price and was very good. if you have a car, you are entitled of a 30% discount on a public car park near the hotel. Loved the buffet restaurant next to it. went there everyday for dinner. one fault: the reception is one floor below entrance of the hotel, with no lift. can be difficult if you are elderly and have problems carrying heavy luggage. from the reception floor, you have two lifts to the rooms. if return to Madrid, would stay there again. if you want luxury, this is not the hotel for you. so pay luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saqrajan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Spain and stayed at Hotel Rex. I must admit this was the first time booking hotel based on reviews on this site and we were thrilled with what we got! We had a triple room which was perfect. 3 solid beds and an awesome bathroom/shower. The location was fantastic right on Gran Via near several metro lines! There was a grocery store right next door as well and it was very close to the main areas! Breakfast buffet was included and it was awesome! Great value for money I highly recommended this hotel for those wishing to stay in Madrid and explore the city! The Hotel was central we felt totally safe with our belongings in the room. Yes there is a safe and you have to put 1 Euro in when you need to close it but its a small price to pay for what your locking up inside! I will def be book this hotel should I ever re visit Madrid! Can't say enough..absolutely loved it! ps If you are a very very light sleeper then ask for a room not facing the street. Our room faced the street (Gran Via) we were on the 8th floor and thou there was some noise it was totally bearable we were def able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Redecoration”
Reviews.Author: davesbirdDublin
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay in this Hotel and the best thing about it was the location, it is right in the middle of gran via so easy to get to all the places of interest. Metro station close by and they only cost 1euro. Plenty of bars and restaurants around and I would recommend the James Joyce Irish bar, good food,good sports and good fun bar. The bathroom smelt like a sewer and the bedroom carpet needs to be thrown in the bin. The staff are not very helpful or friendly. Breakfast was nice, the usual cereal, rolls,toast, cheese and ham, they do not give a choice of coffee or tea and when we asked for hot water to make tea we got dagger's look from them. Only 2 small lifts one holds 3 people the other 4 so we had to walk down 9 flights of stairs for breakfast, not good if you are older or infirm.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but dodgy staff”
Reviews.Author: ian_in_dublin
Reviews.Content: Standard hotel nothing special or really bad. except for that i was was tired from travelling and was resting in the late evening and my girlfriend went out to look around. Less then 5 minutes later my door opened i looked up and a man was in my room and said sorry to me and left after he saw me, I went down to the desk and she told me it must have been a thief. Then she told me it was the maintenance man and he was to change a bulb this was at 21.45. I checked the room no bulbs blown. Also the card slot inside the room for the electricity to work also turns on a light outside your room, which is why this man thought the room was empty. The hotel has ignored my complaints. I have rang from Ireland and no reply so hence this message. It is a good city worth seeing. finally they charge for use of the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious and clean rooms on the Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: EmilyBee4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Rex for a weekend and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room! It was very spacious, as was the bathroom. The room was very clean and towels were changed everyday, which was good. The room also had a flat screen TV with some English channels. The buffet breakfast had lots of choice, from fresh fruit to churros and cereals! Though if you need anything at breakfast, the staff there don't speak any English. The best thing about the hotel would have to be it's location in Madrid. It is within walking distance of Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor (approx. 15 mins) and further afield if you want to walk it. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “hotel rex madrid”
Reviews.Author: ikuropka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, with metro stops very close by. All of the main tourist attractions are just a couple of short metro stops away(and probably within walking distance). It was cold when we arrived, but the hotel room was lovely and warm and cosy.The breakfast was great, and served right up to 11am. Overall great value for money in a great location. There could have been more information for tourists, for example some reading material in the hotel room. We had to ask hotel staff for directions and information, and they were helpful enough, but not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: dinka1
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 nights (2 rooms) in Hotel Rex. The serivce is very unfriendly. The fact that you hace to go down a whole flight of strairs to get to the reception makes this place not suitable for older people or people with limitations. The internet never worked despite the promises Breakfast was less than average. The price was fair

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: petermalta
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the breakfast is very good and the room was nice and spacious overlooking the Gran Via. What more could you want ? We arrived on an early morning flight and were kindly given a room (which would not have been adequate for the whole stay as it was cramped and with a window facing a wall) hours before check in time, so we can't really complain. The next day i asked for a change in rooms, and we were given a really nice one on the 2nd floor with a nice view of Gran Via. Good beds and no noise whatsoever. The only cause for complaint would be the lifts as they are miniscule and take ages to arrive, but we only used them once, on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ROWDAM
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Madrid, Hotel was clean and comfy we was on a back room so got plenty of sleep, we was asked if we wanted back or front, bath had a few chips in but nothing to bad, the only down side was the breakfast was rubbish, eggs bacon and sausage was cold, didn't go hungary though as they had toast, cheeese and all other stuff that you get in a most hotels. The hotel is in a great loctation near all metros and you can walk everything is close by all the shops etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "Rex" (latin for "KING") though...”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rex hotel for 3 nights during the weekend when Madrid celebrated La Noche en Blanco and the 100th year Anniversary of Gran Via, where this hotel is located. The location is simply amazing, in the very middle of Gran Via, near all the main attractions and two subway stations (Callao and Gran Via). The hotel itself needs to undergo a major refurbishment and upgrading since both the facade and the inside are old fashioned. The room, described as superior, was just a standard double with a queen sized bed, but it was clean and so was the quite big bathroom. There is no fridge in the room Ther buffet breakfast is good and offers plenty of food to chose from. The staff was very friendly and helpful even if they didn't provide a remote control after they were asked for a working one for a couple of times. Anyways, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,i don't understand all the complains”
Reviews.Author: baukeOostzaan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 3 nights with 17 friends and we were afraid that we will have to stay in the ''hotel of horror"'after reading some of the reviews.But after our stay wereally think people want to complain because the hotel was outstanding.Good location,clean rooms,good breakfast and friendly staff.And also really cheap.I n ormally never write reviews ,but for this hotel i make exception.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Horrors”
Reviews.Author: MrWozere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days. The experience was the worst (hotel-wise) of my life. The Reception is downstairs (who's ever heard of that?). The Receptionists are like the waiters in Madrid - loud and rude, and none of them speak any English. My room had a broken door, which despite being mended twice still didn't close properly. My bed was broken and my wardrobe too. My requests to change rooms were met with responses that the hotel was 'full', which I doubt. Also the floors were dirty and the bathroom had insects. The only good thing is the location, which is superb. I noted that this is no longer a Tryp hotel and I'm not surprised. My recommendation to you would be find another hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and non-cooperative staff”
Reviews.Author: Yafeya
Reviews.Content: Once you are out, they don;t want to know you, it looks like. I requested the invoice to be sent via email, they hang up on me, I called many times, the same outcome. Will not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, HORRIBLE BEDS AND UNFRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSCRUTINIZE
Reviews.Content: Can someone please teach the front desk to smile? Maybe they sleep on the hotel beds and look so unhappy. Come on, Spain is one of the friendliest countries in Europe and everywhere we stayed - Barcelona and Seville - we were greeted warmly with smiles and hospitality. Why this demeanor? The breakfast is bountiful but they run out of stuff quickly - so get there early. If you want a great location this is it - good value for the location, and take a sheet to cover the carpets, so you don't feel "germy" when you walk barefoot. If only they changed the carpets in the rooms, I would give this a 4-star rating (and of course the matress).

Reviews.Title: “Location and Little More”
Reviews.Author: johnecheveste
Reviews.Content: The best, and virtually only thing this hotel has going for it is location. It is conveniently located on Gran Via in the theater area, close to a Metro station and a short walk to Plaza Mayor and the Palace beyond. The hotel itself is a bit shoody ,rooms are miniscule, Internet service is over-priced, and the breakfast is lacking. Overall disapponting.

Reviews.Title: “good location, price and rooms are ok”
Reviews.Author: TravelBOYPortugal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tryp chain of ancient, very well located, situated on Gran Via, 3 min walk from Puerta del Sol, the hotel staff is very friendly and cordial, the rooms for the price paid, they are very good, with air conditioning, TV with international channels and the bathroom is also fine. Breakfast is served in the hotel restaurant overlooking the Gran Via and is available to a limited continental breakfast could have more variety of fruit and cereals. In my opinion quality/money is very well . If I go back to madrid will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING”
Reviews.Author: phaelopia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Rex in July and quite liked the hotel. The staff were not terribly helpful but I enjoyed my stay there anyway. While I was in Spain, I only used my credit card at this hotel and it was cloned. VISA was onto it and they have phoned me and changed my card number and let me know, but someone at this hotel is into credit card fraud!

Reviews.Title: “good value if you have low expectations”
Reviews.Author: Air_Palma
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. Beside that, be prepare for basic (or no) service, old and badly refurnished room, 14' CRT TV, very old fashioned bathroom. The price was only about 45€ for a comfortable bed in a quiet room, so why complaint?

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: LonKiwi79
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Tryp Rex on Gran Via. In fact, I am surprised by some of the negative reviews about this hotel - and really do wonder what exactly these people expect from a hotel that is such a good price in a prime location in a fairly pricey European city!! If you want perfection, I'm afraid you're going to have to pay a bit more than this place costs! The location was absolutely perfect for exploring Madrid - we went everywhere on foot and all the major sights were very quick and easy to get to from the Hotel - it was no more than about a 10 minute walk for us to get from the hotel to any of the top attractions in the old city area. We had the pleasure of meeting a lovely man on reception when we arrived very early (midnight-ish) on Saturday morning (Antonio, I think his name was..? He was missing a couple of fingers on each hand..). He was so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble, and he quickly pulled out a map and started showing us all sorts of things to see, suggested walking routes, etc - including local tips and inside knowledge! He was one of the best reception staff we've come across - even better than some 5 star hotels. Our room on the 4th floor was very spacious, spotlessly clean, and because we had asked for a quiet room (as we usually do), we didn't have any problems with noise at all (besides, even if we had heard the street noise outside, we probably would've expected it, having chosen a basic hotel in such a central location!). We had a comfortable bed, lots of space in our room and bathroom, excellent and very quiet air-conditioning, and a brilliant shower with extremely good pressure. Ok, so the decor was a little dated, but for the price it was great value for money, very comfortable and functional, and realistically we didn't expect it to be overly flash given the price! The only (minor) negative was that it seemed it was necessary to take one of the two lifts to get to and from reception (and therefore in and out of the front entrance), and because they were tiny and a bit touchy, it meant waiting for the lift a little more than you would usually. It wasn't actually a terribly long wait and it didn't bother us, but if you were a bit impatient you might care more than we did. Given that we headed out in the morning and then only came back to get freshened up before dinner - we were too busy out exploring the city - so it really wasn't a problem. We think this hotel was perfectly good value for money. We got it nice and cheap through a package deal and were more than happy with it, and an excellent location for exploring Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Low Expectations that were definitely exceeded”
Reviews.Author: 1662azams
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a very cheap rate basically because of the good location. After reading the reviews before I stayed here I thought my stay in Madrid would be a night mare, but it was anything but that. The room was very spacious and very clean. There was a very small smell initially when I walked in but that went away as soon as I opened the window. We had a great view of the gran via from the 5th floor which was really cool. Although it was noisy, that was not a big deal because both me and my girl friend are heavy sleepers. The Gran Via is also one of the busiest streets in the city so you have to expect that. And if it would ever get too loud you can just close the window. The double bed was two twin beds pushed together which was kind of annoying because their are wood floors so the beds would always separate when we would get intimate. This was initially annoying but me and my girlfriend actually thought it was funny and we made the best out of it so it was perfectly fine. That was probably the only bad thing about the room. The bathroom was great. The staff were very nice even though we forgot our passports. The only problems were the twin beds pushed together as the double bed and the noise, but that is only if you are really picky which we weren't. For the price we got on the hotel, you can't go wrong. This is probably the best location in Madrid. Excelent stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, noisy, and a/c doesn't work until June.”
Reviews.Author: Bandi07
Reviews.Content: The location is very central, which means NOISY. Despite the double-glazed windows, the street noise kept me awake all night for three nights. Sirens, loud drunken singing and shouting, etc. And my room was on the side street, not on Gran Via. And in early May it was already pretty hot (28 degC) but they said the air conditioning wouldn't be turned on until June, so the room was hot and stuffy. Internet was 15 euros/day and worked only smasmodically. Price was definitely not in line with the quality of the experience. The Tryp Ambassador is one street back, much quieter, one more star, about the same price and the a/c was working.

Reviews.Title: “uhhhhhhhhhhhhhh...... I found the dump in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: blackthorne
Reviews.Content: Ok so here it is. Location great, Staff friendly, especially the older bald man. The room is a fricken nightmare. You like to smell old and dirt stay here. The carpets have not been changed since the 1920s they look like my oil mat in my garage if I had one. The t.v. when you get home after a long night on the city is 12 inches and has 5 channels all in Spanish. The molding on the wall is coming off and the phone does not work at all and is brown from dirt. The bathroom obviously has been remodeled and is not horrible but very small. Like I said location is great and staff friendly but thats it. Oh I forgot our queen bed is two twins pushed together and separated by sheets. So there ya have viva Madrid!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - what's the problem?”
Reviews.Author: road_to_romance
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews here, we had very low expectations of this place. We got a great deal on rates (blind auction) and so we were wary (based on reviews). However we were delighted with the result! The hotel does indeed have a lobby at basement level but the staff were fine and the room was spacious, clean and quiet. This is a perfectly respectable mid range hotel in a convenient central Madrid location. We had a great stay here and would most definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: merlin0022
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Tryp Rex recently. Room was facing the Gran Viva, but with windows closed traffic noise wasn't too bad, tested the A/C and it didn't seem to work (perhaps as it was switched off for the winter) however if it didn't work in the summer could be a serious problem. Walls certainly could use a new paint job, and overall decoration was a bit tired. Location was excellent and we only paid £10 a night as we booked on a web special so no complaints about value for money. I probably would have been reasonably happy up to £40....assuming the A/C worked or we weren't facing the street in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service at hotel - would never recommend”
Reviews.Author: RaymondWPereira
Reviews.Content: I had encountered a terrible experience during my recent stay at Tryp Rex Hotel in Madrid. The rooms facing the Gran Via are extremely NOISY. My friend stayed there. In my room, the towels were torn and frayed. The internet connection did NOT work and nothing was done to assist me to retrieve my emails. Having travelled to numerous destinations round the world and staying in many hotels of different categories, I found the staff at the reception extremely NON hospitable and not at all welcoming. On the contrary, I thought they were very rude at the reception. I tried to speak to the Manager to inform him to improve on this but I was not given access. I tried to borrow a spoon at 8pm one night and was told that this was not possible and they refused to assist and finally did not even lend me on. It was claimed that it was not possible to open the restaurant. Whilst the staff at the reception were not busy, they (3 of them) did not even assist me to open. They left me to my own devices to open the door, bring out the bags and up the stairs and later to come down to close the door whilst the receptionists were just only chatting at 4pm on the depature date. I will definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone visiting madrid as there are many hotels with great deals. I was so upset with them that I nearly cancelled the onward bookings with the same chain. I really hope that the management will do something to rectify or improve.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for shopping...”
Reviews.Author: rmatos79
Reviews.Content: The Best thing about him.... it´s the Great Location... in city center...in Grand Via...!! There you can visit the center by walk... not needing to got by bus, taxi, or subway...! Average rooms.. good for traveleres... you can reserv a room using the site of hotel, you just need a credit card...! I paid one night... 80,25 Euros (saturday), for 2 persons! Near the subway (30 m)... about 45minutes.... using the subway form the airport... you have to catch 3 lines... (2 euros trip/person)! There you can shop.. you have Fnac, Corte Inglês.. and lots of stores nearby...!! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but will likely not return.....”
Reviews.Author: TriniTravelingGirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 seperate nights while on holiday - October 2008... For location - it's fabulous! - Right in the middle of Gran Via, walking distance to Sol.. the Metro.....and everything that you can possibly want to do.....Perfect place if you want to be in the middle of the action... However! - my first HUGE complaint is that the reception lobby is one floor DOWNSTAIRS from the street level!!.. Quite dumb if you ask me!... Especially if you have heavy luggage!... Why don't they have an elevator to bring you down is beyond me!... and there's no one there to help you upon arrival ( if needed).. I am a woman that has vowed if I can't carry my own luggage....I won't take it... but tugging my pieces down 2 flights was quite irritating. Their 2 tiny elevators are quite funny... we used both elevators to take our luggage upstairs.. as each elevator has a 3 person limit....My first night there.... Our room was spacious.. clean.. hardwood floors... which was a nice surprise!...Large bathroom....very nice... The reception does not answer the phone if you call - which is terrible.... so ask all questions before you head up. Their vending machines suck.. so go next door to VIPS... which is a great shop with everything that you will need.... and it's open very late!.....sandwiches/chips/drinks/mags/etc. My second night ( after returning from morocco) 2 days later was not as good as the first. I was given a room on a the 7th floor.. I think...maybe 9th.?... way in the back... which had additional steps in the hallway... and steps to go down into the room.... NOT fun with 4 heavy suitcases between my friend and myself....The room was large.... but the continuous steps were an issue...... So I asked for another room....... bad mistake.....got stuck with a TINY room.... and the bathroom was the size of a closet.... the toilet and bedet were so close together... you'd have to sit sideways.....haha... it was quite amusing.. as I only needed a cheap hotel to stay at on my last night in Madrid...... since we were going to be out all nite.... Didn't want to spend too much $$...... I used their luggage storage - during the day.. which was fine.. and the bellman helped us out with all of our luggage....so it all ended on an OK note. Just an FYI - I stayed at the Sofitel Madrid - Plaza de Espana for my previous 4 nights in Madrid.....- which was PERFECT.....I only stayed here for 2 nights... where my hotel choice really wasn't that important..... Would I stay here again?... Sure... but only with a backpack... and if I can get the large room I had.. It's clean.. decent... cheap..... otherwise.... I'll be back at the Sofitel!.... Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “NICE SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: FRANKLEONE
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this hotel since I was in Madrid for an important fair and I found an incredible rate trough rates to go.. Well, it was really a good surprise! My room was pretty small but clean, with new forniture a nice bathroom, tv, frigobar etc.. The location is perfect to go anywhere in Madrid: 50 metres from one of the main subway station! Very suggested for independent travellers, business travellers and families too..

Reviews.Title: “70's Throwback at 2050 prices”
Reviews.Author: TherealDC
Reviews.Content: Let's get one thing straight, first of all this hotel is in a great postion. But that is where the positives end. You walk in through a door directly on the street and down into a basement reception where you meet the slowest staff. When you have finally managed to check in, you then make your way past the 70's finished lounge area and up in one of the 2 lifts. Now I say lifts, 1 of them holds 4 (Kate Moss, Nicole Richie, Paris and Karen Carpenter perhaps). The other holds 3 (or 1 in old money). When you get to your room, you will find tired, 70's styling and poor quality beds and furnishings (I broke the chair when I sat on it). The trip back to the street takes you past the floor where you should get out of the lift, back to reception where you then walk back up the stairs to the street. An attempt by stairs takes you to an emergency exit into an alley. The internet access that I had paid for 24hrs on ran out after 2, reception did not answer the phone and the thought of a trip in the lift to the brains on reception was too much for me. I went to bed. Incidentally, I had to restore all my internet settings the day after to stop my browser bringing the hotel's login screen up. No doubt the receptionist wrote the code. At night, the noise of the police directing traffic outside with whistles stops about 2am. The relative silence is then broken throughout the night by the noisiest plumbing I have ever heard. When my room neighbour got up at 5am for a shower and presumably to get ready for an early start, that was it. Oh, and it cost me 202GBP for a night's stay. All in all, a tired, badly organised and arranged hotel that I won't be visiting again. DC

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: barraken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Tryp Rex Hotel because we missed our connection. Iberia Airlines booked the room for us. The accommodations were as poor as any hotel either of us had ever seen. The room smelled like mildew. There were cracks in the walls, stains on the sheets and carpet, water stains on the ceiling, and to top it off, no less than four live cockroaches in various parts of the room. There were no other rooms available and we did not sleep a wink that night. We returned to the airport as quickly as possible the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “More or less”
Reviews.Author: MLisboa
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid with 20 more friends and we have stayed at Tryp Rex. The hotel has a superb location and, as such, they have lots of clients. This means they do not have to care with the clients they have. Facilities need some rehabilitation (mainly the common areas and some windows), and the hotel is pretty noisy (you can hear other guests having shower). My bedroom window was looking at the inside, it had no natural light! Besides, the management is inflexible. If you can get a good price consider Tryp Rex. Otherwise try anything else...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice suprise!”
Reviews.Author: Pula
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located on the main street. Everything was near and easy to find. Room was beautifully decorated in green colours with spacious and clean bathroom. Only negative thing that I could think of would be a very small elevators. Breakfast was rich and various. This hotel was a very nice suprise that made our stay in Madrid more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Doss House Inn”
Reviews.Author: Chilli_Oil
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from Madrid (yesterday). I have just read the reviews on this hotel and cannot believe what I have been reading. I have been to many, many hotels worldwide. This one really takes the biscuit! Firstly we were told that this was a four star hotel. Absolutley no way!!! I would rate this no more than a TWO Star at best and only because of the location. Where do I start? Well the carpets and curtains are very very dirty - actually no they were filthy, the nets had NEVER been washed! They were dark grey. The Fridge,TV, Telephone, safe etc were outdated by a decade. The beds were very very low. The toilet had a WC, Sink, Bath and bidet all contained in a 7X6 room which ment you would have to brush past the bidet and sink to get to the toilet. If you are taller than 4'11" then forget sitting on the toilet - you just have to do your business standing up or just use the bath! The sink had a couple of specks of blood in it. The good points are; the bed surprisingly comfortable (although I couldnt bear to change into my night clothes) and the location is fantastic. Reception is good. There are two incredibly small lifts, one holds 3 persons, the other 4. Take it from me if you are used to 3, 4 or 5 star hotels - do not stay here. If you are used to 1 or 2 stars (or a cardboard box under a bridge) then this hotel will be adequate (just!).

Reviews.Title: “Above-average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: makkuo
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was reasonably clean and tidy, although small. The receptionist was also helpful. The location is very central, right on Gran Via, and only a short walk to Calle de Precaidos (a pedestrianised shopping street) towards Puerta del Sol. I was given a room without any view (only a wall behind the curtains), but the good thing is that it's away from the main street so I was able to get some sleep. If you are traveling with elderly people, you may have to think twice about staying here. The main entrance has a set of stairs leading down to the receptionist. The bell boy had to help carry my bags to my room. This is actually the first time in which I have to pay to use the safe in my room (1 Euro). They are usually free. The telephone wasn't touch tone so I wasn't able to connect to certain telephone lines which required me to "press 1 for English...2 for...". There wasn't any tea maker in the room so I couldn't get any hot water to drink. I think this is an above-average 3 star hotel but I wouldn't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise - Tryp Rex”
Reviews.Author: dhammer53
Reviews.Content: We waited for the very last minute to book a hotel room in Madrid since we weren't sure of our dates. Two weeks prior to the trip, I got an e mail with the Solemia web specials. The Tryp Hotel group is part of that company. They were offering 30 Euro a night room (USD$36) for 2 people in mid-October. I booked 3 nights since the hotel was on Gran Via. The Gran Villa is like a Times Square area. Very busy. Central location. It's a 5 minute walk to Puerta de Sol. That's a main tourist point. The museums are a 15 minute walk. I wasn't expecting very much for the price. You can imagine my surprise when I opened the door to the room and was greeted with a 4* room. Room 408 faced the side street. The room size was 12 x 15. Two double beds pushed together. All tile floor. Bathroom was all marble and spacious. Good towels. This could have been a Hilton or Sheraton if there was carpeting. The bathroom had all the ammeneties a major hotel chain would offer. Water pressure in the shower was outstanding. At this price breakfast buffet was not included. Otherwise the cost is 9 euros a person. You can eat locally for 2 to 3 euros or more. Internet access at the lobby computer for 2 Euros for 30 minutes. Plenty of internet access locally between 1 and 3 Euro an hour. Elevators are typically European. Small. Only negative...main entrance to the hotel requires walking down steps to reach the lobby. The hotel is less than a block from the Metro station. A Starbucks is a block away. I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “May I rate this hotel with less than one star?”
Reviews.Author: debphoto
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was the absolute worst hotel I've stayed at internationally. Where do I begin? The bathroom and bedroom were literally crumbling apart. There was dry rot all around the tub & door. At night, the hotel turned off the air conditioner and since the hotel was located in the heart of Madrid, you couldn't sleep with a window open because of the noise. During siesta, we couldn't rest or relax through the "sounds of renovation" (pounding of the hammers and grinding of drills). Our blackout curtains were worthless; ripped, falling apart and held up by 2 safety pins (ours). The beds reminded me of staying with my grandparents. "It was a perfectly good bed in 1940 when we bought it!" Our room looked like it hadn't been painted since 1940 as well. Last but not least, there are 2 elevators for this entire hotel. That makes sense. About the only thing going for this place is its central location. Grab your running shoes, personal fans and ear plugs if you must stay at the Tryp Rex Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A positive time at the Tryp Rex”
Reviews.Author: hdcnm
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from Spain. We had booked a 5 star Gran Lux hotel in Marbella and opted out after 5 days. We decided to go to Madrid. Since it was in the middle of a festival we had difficulty with last minute reservations but we were able to book the Tryp Rex for three nights. We arrived by train, nervous - Tryp Rex is a 3 star hotel and we didn't know what we had gotten ourselves in for. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was right in the middle of Madrid, within walking distance of restaurants, shops and sights. The room was clean and reasonably well kept. The breakfast buffet was great and the staff was helpful and always pleasant. It was a bit noisy since it was in the middle of the city but we left the hotel in Marbella because it was so quiet and distant from town. We only have positive things to say about the Tryp Rex!

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Eldeano1961
Reviews.Content: My young son and I have just come back from Madrid where we spent 6 nights at the Tryp Rex. The hotel is in a great location. It is on Gran Via just between Callao and Santo Domingo metro stations which gives you direct access to 3 lines. Plaza de Espana, Sol and Plaza Mayor are within easy walking distance as are the areas of Opera and Santa Ana for bars in the evening. The hotel itself is fine. The rooms are nothing wonderful, but adequate and the bathrooms are small. Couldn't work out the room safes - I kept losing my Euro coins. There was a degree of noise at night from the traffic. However, we were so tired from our walking and the fresh air that it didn't worry us at all. So, in summary, a reasonable hotel in a great location.
